title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\PatchSubnetworkRequest
name: PatchSubnetworkRequest
description:
A request message for Subnetworks.Patch. See the method description for details.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.PatchSubnetworkRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.drain_timeout_seconds
params.description: The drain timeout specifies the upper bound in seconds on the amount of time allowed to drain connections from the current ACTIVE subnetwork to the current BACKUP subnetwork. The drain timeout is only applicable when the following conditions are true: - the subnetwork being patched has purpose = INTERNAL_HTTPS_LOAD_BALANCER - the subnetwork being patched has role = BACKUP - the patch request is setting the role to ACTIVE. Note that after this patch operation the roles of the ACTIVE and BACKUP subnetworks will be swapped.

params.name: data.region
params.description: Name of the region scoping this request.

params.name: data.request_id
params.description: An optional request ID to identify requests. Specify a unique request ID so that if you must retry your request, the server will know to ignore the request if it has already been completed. For example, consider a situation where you make an initial request and the request times out. If you make the request again with the same request ID, the server can check if original operation with the same request ID was received, and if so, will ignore the second request. This prevents clients from accidentally creating duplicate commitments. The request ID must be a valid UUID with the exception that zero UUID is not supported ( 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000).

params.name: data.subnetwork
params.description: Name of the Subnetwork resource to patch.
